comments:
My JVM crashes on occasion when closing a wizard that contains a SWT_AWT-based 
swing JPanel.  Can reproduce, however the problem doesn't always occur -- 
usually 1 of 6 wizard invocations will show the problem.

The stack trace displayed by the JVM is not always the same.  I've pasted two 
of them below:

Are you creating the composite passed to SWT_AWT.new_Frame() with the 
SWT.EMBEDDED style?

No, I'm using SWT.NULL.

BTW, I've searched the Eclipse help for the keyword 'EMBEDDED', and nothing 
relevant comes up.  Also the javadocs for Composite (and all of it's super-
classes) don't mention SWT.EMBEDDED.

We wrote the java doc for SWT_AWT latest week (maybe this Monday) and I just 
added EMBEDDED as one of the styles Composite supports.

Anyway, are you able to reproduce to segment fault after changing the code to 
use SWT.EMBEDDED? If not, I will close the bug report.

After changing the style to SWT.EMBEDDED, the 
"java.lang.NullPointerException: null pData"
seems to have disappeared, and the VM hasn't crashed yet.

Would it make sense for the SWT_AWT.new_Frame() method to check the style bits 
on the composite and throw an IllegalArgumentException if the EMBEDDED style 
is not present?

The latest code (HEAD) already checks the style bit and throws 
IllegalArgumentException. I will close this bug, please reopen if you see the 
crash again. Thanks.
Awesome!  Thanks for your quick response on this one.
